intro: Agelaea pinnata, commonly known as the featherleaf agelaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves that resemble feathers, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Agelaea pinnata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
